sinaiticus.text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, a called apostle, set apart to the gospel of God,

verses.text: Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, a called apostle, set apart to the gospel of God,

sinaiticus.text: which he announced beforehand through his prophets in the holy Scriptures,

verses.text: which he announced beforehand through his prophets in the holy Scriptures,

sinaiticus.text: concerning his Son, who was born of the posterity of David according to the flesh,

verses.text: concerning his Son, who was born of the posterity of David according to the flesh,

sinaiticus.text: who was constituted Son of God in power, according to the spirit of holiness, from the resurrection of the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,

verses.text: who was constituted Son of God in power, according to the spirit of holiness, from the resurrection of the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,

sinaiticus.text: through whom we received grace and apostleship in order to the obedience of faith among all the nations for his name’s sake,

verses.text: through whom we received grace and apostleship in order to the obedience of faith among all the nations for his name’s sake,

sinaiticus.text: among whom are you also the called, of Jesus Christ:

verses.text: among whom are you also the called, of Jesus Christ:

sinaiticus.text: to all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called saints. Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: to all that are in Rome, beloved of God, called saints. Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

sinaiticus.text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ concerning you all, that your faith is spoken of in all the world.

verses.text: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ concerning you all, that your faith is spoken of in all the world.

sinaiticus.text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you,

verses.text: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the gospel of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you,

sinaiticus.text: always in my prayers making request if by any means now at last I may be prospered in the will of God to come to you.

verses.text: always in my prayers making request if by any means now at last I may be prospered in the will of God to come to you.

sinaiticus.text: For I greatly desire to see you, that I may share with you some spiritual gift, in order that you may be strengthened;

verses.text: For I greatly desire to see you, that I may share with you some spiritual gift, in order that you may be strengthened;

sinaiticus.text: that is, that I may be comforted together among you through the faith that is in each other, both yours and mine.

verses.text: that is, that I may be comforted together among you through the faith that is in each other, both yours and mine.

sinaiticus.text: But I desire that you be not ignorant, brethren, that I often purposed to come to you, and have been hindered to the present time, that I might have some fruit also among you, even as among the rest of the Gentiles.

verses.text: But I desire that you be not ignorant, brethren, that I often purposed to come to you, and have been hindered to the present time, that I might have some fruit also among you, even as among the rest of the Gentiles.

sinaiticus.text: Both to Greeks and to Barbarians, both to wise and to unwise, am I debtor:

verses.text: Both to Greeks and to Barbarians, both to wise and to unwise, am I debtor:

sinaiticus.text: so as far as I am able, I am ready to preach the gospel to you also that are in Rome.

verses.text: so as far as I am able, I am ready to preach the gospel to you also that are in Rome.

sinaiticus.text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel; for it is the power of God in order to salvation to every one that believes, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

verses.text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel; for it is the power of God in order to salvation to every one that believes, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

sinaiticus.text: For in it is revealed God’s righteousness by faith for faith; as it is written: He that is righteous by faith shall live.

verses.text: For in it is revealed God’s righteousness by faith for faith; as it is written: He that is righteous by faith shall live.

sinaiticus.text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men that repress the truth in

verses.text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men that repress the truth in

sinaiticus.text: because that which is known of God is manifest in them, for God has manifested it to them.

verses.text: because that which is known of God is manifest in them, for God has manifested it to them.

sinaiticus.text: For his attributes which are invisible, since the creation of the world, are clearly seen, being perceived by the things that are made, both his eternal power and divinity, so that they are without excuse;

verses.text: For his attributes which are invisible, since the creation of the world, are clearly seen, being perceived by the things that are made, both his eternal power and divinity, so that they are without excuse;

sinaiticus.text: because, though they knew God, they did not glorify him as God, or give him thanks, but became vain in their reasonings, and their heart, void of understanding, was darkened.

verses.text: because, though they knew God, they did not glorify him as God, or give him thanks, but became vain in their reasonings, and their heart, void of understanding, was darkened.

sinaiticus.text: Professing to be wise, they became fools,

verses.text: Professing to be wise, they became fools,

sinaiticus.text: and exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

verses.text: and exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and fourfooted beasts, and creeping things.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore God delivered them up in the desires of their hearts to uncleanness, so that their bodies were dishonored among no them;

verses.text: Wherefore God delivered them up in the desires of their hearts to uncleanness, so that their bodies were dishonored among no them;

sinaiticus.text: and these exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever: Amen.

verses.text: and these exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed for ever: Amen.

sinaiticus.text: For this reason God delivered them up to dishonorable passions; for their females exchanged the natural use for that against nature,

verses.text: For this reason God delivered them up to dishonorable passions; for their females exchanged the natural use for that against nature,

sinaiticus.text: and in like manner also the males, leaving the natural use of the female, were inflamed in their lust one for another, males with males working the indecency, and receiving in themselves the due reward of their error.

verses.text: and in like manner also the males, leaving the natural use of the female, were inflamed in their lust one for another, males with males working the indecency, and receiving in themselves the due reward of their error.

sinaiticus.text: And as they did not approve of holding God in their knowledge, God delivered them up to a mind incapable of approving, that they might do things unbecoming,

verses.text: And as they did not approve of holding God in their knowledge, God delivered them up to a mind incapable of approving, that they might do things unbecoming,

sinaiticus.text: having been filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness malice, covetousness; full of envy murder, strife, deceit, malignity

verses.text: having been filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness malice, covetousness; full of envy murder, strife, deceit, malignity

sinaiticus.text: whisperers, backbiters, haters of God, insolent, haughty, boasters: inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

verses.text: whisperers, backbiters, haters of God, insolent, haughty, boasters: inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

sinaiticus.text: without understanding, covenant-breakers, without natural affection, unmerciful:

verses.text: without understanding, covenant-breakers, without natural affection, unmerciful:

sinaiticus.text: who, acknowledging the just decree of God, that those who practice such things are worthy of death, not only do them, but approve those that practice them.

verses.text: who, acknowledging the just decree of God, that those who practice such things are worthy of death, not only do them, but approve those that practice them.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whoever thou art that judges! For in what thou judgest the other, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

verses.text: Wherefore thou art inexcusable, O man, whoever thou art that judges! For in what thou judgest the other, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest doest the same things.

sinaiticus.text: For we know that the judgment of God is according to truth, against those that practice such things.272

verses.text: For we know that the judgment of God is according to truth, against those that practice such things.272

sinaiticus.text: But thinkest thou this, O man that judgest those who practice such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

verses.text: But thinkest thou this, O man that judgest those who practice such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

sinaiticus.text: Or dost thou despise the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering, not understanding that the goodness of God leads thee to repentance?

verses.text: Or dost thou despise the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering, not understanding that the goodness of God leads thee to repentance?

sinaiticus.text: But, according to thy hardness and impenitent heart, thou dost treasure up for thyself wrath in a day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,

verses.text: But, according to thy hardness and impenitent heart, thou dost treasure up for thyself wrath in a day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,

sinaiticus.text: who will render to each one according to his works;

verses.text: who will render to each one according to his works;

sinaiticus.text: to those that, by perseverance in good work, seek for glory and honor and incorruptibility, eternal life;

verses.text: to those that, by perseverance in good work, seek for glory and honor and incorruptibility, eternal life;

sinaiticus.text: but to those that are of party-spirit, and obey not the truth, but obey unrighteousness, wrath and indignation shall be rendered.

verses.text: but to those that are of party-spirit, and obey not the truth, but obey unrighteousness, wrath and indignation shall be rendered.

sinaiticus.text: Affliction and anguish shall be on every soul of man that works out that which is evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Greek;

verses.text: Affliction and anguish shall be on every soul of man that works out that which is evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Greek;

sinaiticus.text: but glory and honor and peace to every one that works that which is good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

verses.text: but glory and honor and peace to every one that works that which is good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek.

sinaiticus.text: For there is no acceptance of persons with God.

verses.text: For there is no acceptance of persons with God.

sinaiticus.text: For as many as sinned without law shall also perish without law; and as many as sinned under the law shall be judged by the law;

verses.text: For as many as sinned without law shall also perish without law; and as many as sinned under the law shall be judged by the law;

sinaiticus.text: for not the hearers of law are righteous before God, but the doers of law shall be declared righteous.

verses.text: for not the hearers of law are righteous before God, but the doers of law shall be declared righteous.

sinaiticus.text: For whenever Gentiles, that have no law, do by nature the things of the law, these, not having law, are a law to themselves:

verses.text: For whenever Gentiles, that have no law, do by nature the things of the law, these, not having law, are a law to themselves:

sinaiticus.text: who show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing testimony, and their reasonings between one another bringing accusation, or also making excuse

verses.text: who show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience also bearing testimony, and their reasonings between one another bringing accusation, or also making excuse

sinaiticus.text: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men through Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

verses.text: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men through Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

sinaiticus.text: But if thou art named Jew, and restest on the law, and makest thy boast in God,

verses.text: But if thou art named Jew, and restest on the law, and makest thy boast in God,

sinaiticus.text: and knowest his will, and provest things that differ, being instructed out of the law;

verses.text: and knowest his will, and provest things that differ, being instructed out of the law;

sinaiticus.text: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light to those that are in darkness,

verses.text: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light to those that are in darkness,

sinaiticus.text: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law:

verses.text: an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having the form of knowledge and of truth in the law:

sinaiticus.text: thou, then, that teachest another, teachest not thou thyself? Thou that preachest that men should not steal, dost thou steal?

verses.text: thou, then, that teachest another, teachest not thou thyself? Thou that preachest that men should not steal, dost thou steal?

sinaiticus.text: Thou that sayest that men should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? Thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou rob temples?

verses.text: Thou that sayest that men should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? Thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou rob temples?

sinaiticus.text: Thou that makest thy boast in the law, through transgression of

verses.text: Thou that makest thy boast in the law, through transgression of

sinaiticus.text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you, as it is written.

verses.text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you, as it is written.

sinaiticus.text: For circumcision indeed profits if thou keep the law; but if thou be a transgressor of law, thy circumcision has become uncircumcision.

verses.text: For circumcision indeed profits if thou keep the law; but if thou be a transgressor of law, thy circumcision has become uncircumcision.

sinaiticus.text: If, then, the uncircumcision keep the judgments of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

verses.text: If, then, the uncircumcision keep the judgments of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision?

sinaiticus.text: And that which is by birth uncircumcision, if it keep the law, will judge thee, who with letter and circumcision art a transgressor of law.

verses.text: And that which is by birth uncircumcision, if it keep the law, will judge thee, who with letter and circumcision art a transgressor of law.

sinaiticus.text: For he is not a Jew that is one outwardly, neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh;

verses.text: For he is not a Jew that is one outwardly, neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh;

sinaiticus.text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart, in spirit, not in letter, whose praise is not of men, but of God.

verses.text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart, in spirit, not in letter, whose praise is not of men, but of God.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, the pre-eminence of the Jew, or what the profit of circumcision?

verses.text: What, then, the pre-eminence of the Jew, or what the profit of circumcision?

sinaiticus.text: Much in every way. First, indeed, that they were intrusted with the oracles of God.

verses.text: Much in every way. First, indeed, that they were intrusted with the oracles of God.

sinaiticus.text: What then? if some were unfaithful, will their unfaithfulness make null the faithfulness of God?

verses.text: What then? if some were unfaithful, will their unfaithfulness make null the faithfulness of God?

sinaiticus.text: Let it not be; but let God become true, but every man a liar, as it is written: That thou mayest be declared just in thy words and mayest overcome when thou art judged.

verses.text: Let it not be; but let God become true, but every man a liar, as it is written: That thou mayest be declared just in thy words and mayest overcome when thou art judged.

sinaiticus.text: But if our unrighteousness renders God’s righteousness conspicuous, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who brings on us the punishment? I speak as a man.

verses.text: But if our unrighteousness renders God’s righteousness conspicuous, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who brings on us the punishment? I speak as a man.

sinaiticus.text: Let it not be; since how shall God judge the world?

verses.text: Let it not be; since how shall God judge the world?

sinaiticus.text: For if the truth of God has, through my lie, become more abundant for his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?

verses.text: For if the truth of God has, through my lie, become more abundant for his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?

sinaiticus.text: And why not say (as we are blasphemously reported, and as some affirm that we do say): Let us do the evil, that the good may come? whose condemnation is just.

verses.text: And why not say (as we are blasphemously reported, and as some affirm that we do say): Let us do the evil, that the good may come? whose condemnation is just.

sinaiticus.text: What then? Do we excel? Not at all; for we have before accused both Jews and Greeks all of being under sin,

verses.text: What then? Do we excel? Not at all; for we have before accused both Jews and Greeks all of being under sin,

sinaiticus.text: as it is written: There is none righteous, no, not one;

verses.text: as it is written: There is none righteous, no, not one;

sinaiticus.text: there is none that understands, there is none that seeks after God:

verses.text: there is none that understands, there is none that seeks after God:

sinaiticus.text: they have all gone out of the way, they have together become unprofitable: there is none that does good, there is not even one.

verses.text: they have all gone out of the way, they have together become unprofitable: there is none that does good, there is not even one.

sinaiticus.text: Their throat is an open sepulcher; with their tongues they have used deceit, the poison of asps is under their lips.

verses.text: Their throat is an open sepulcher; with their tongues they have used deceit, the poison of asps is under their lips.

sinaiticus.text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.274

verses.text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.274

sinaiticus.text: Swift are their feet to shed blood,

verses.text: Swift are their feet to shed blood,

sinaiticus.text: destruction and misery are in their ways,

verses.text: destruction and misery are in their ways,

sinaiticus.text: and the way of peace have they not known.

verses.text: and the way of peace have they not known.

sinaiticus.text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

verses.text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

sinaiticus.text: But we know that whatever things the law says, it speaks to those under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world become guilty before God.

verses.text: But we know that whatever things the law says, it speaks to those under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world become guilty before God.

sinaiticus.text: Because by works of law shall no flesh be declared righteous in his sight; for through law is the knowledge of sin.

verses.text: Because by works of law shall no flesh be declared righteous in his sight; for through law is the knowledge of sin.

sinaiticus.text: But now without law the righteousness of God has been made manifest, being witnessed by the law and the prophets:

verses.text: But now without law the righteousness of God has been made manifest, being witnessed by the law and the prophets:

sinaiticus.text: I say, the righteousness of God, through faith in Jesus Christ, to all that believe. For there is no difference;

verses.text: I say, the righteousness of God, through faith in Jesus Christ, to all that believe. For there is no difference;

sinaiticus.text: for all sinned and do come short of the glory of God,

verses.text: for all sinned and do come short of the glory of God,

sinaiticus.text: being justified freely by his grace, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus,

verses.text: being justified freely by his grace, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus,

sinaiticus.text: whom God set forth as a propitiatory sacrifice through faith in his blood, for a manifestation of his righteousness, because of the passing by of past sins

verses.text: whom God set forth as a propitiatory sacrifice through faith in his blood, for a manifestation of his righteousness, because of the passing by of past sins

sinaiticus.text: in the forbearance of God, with a view to the manifestation of his righteousness in the present time, in order that he might be righteous, and declare righteous him that is of the faith of Jesus.

verses.text: in the forbearance of God, with a view to the manifestation of his righteousness in the present time, in order that he might be righteous, and declare righteous him that is of the faith of Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: Where, then, is the boasting? It is excluded. Through what law? Of works? No; but through the law of faith.

verses.text: Where, then, is the boasting? It is excluded. Through what law? Of works? No; but through the law of faith.

sinaiticus.text: We conclude, then, that a man is declared righteous by faith, without works of law.

verses.text: We conclude, then, that a man is declared righteous by faith, without works of law.

sinaiticus.text: Is he the God of the Jews only? Is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also.

verses.text: Is he the God of the Jews only? Is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also.

sinaiticus.text: Seeing there is one God who will declare the circumcision righteous by faith and the uncircumcision through the faith.

verses.text: Seeing there is one God who will declare the circumcision righteous by faith and the uncircumcision through the faith.

sinaiticus.text: Do we, then, make law void through faith? Let it not be: on the other hand, we establish law.

verses.text: Do we, then, make law void through faith? Let it not be: on the other hand, we establish law.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, shall we say that Abraham, our forefather, has found according to the flesh?

verses.text: What, then, shall we say that Abraham, our forefather, has found according to the flesh?

sinaiticus.text: For, if Abraham was justified by works, he has cause for boasting, but not before God.

verses.text: For, if Abraham was justified by works, he has cause for boasting, but not before God.

sinaiticus.text: For what says the Scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.

verses.text: For what says the Scripture? Abraham believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: But to him that works, the reward is not counted as a favor, but as a

verses.text: But to him that works, the reward is not counted as a favor, but as a

sinaiticus.text: to him, however, that works not, but believes on him that justifies the ungodly man, his faith is counted for righteousness.

verses.text: to him, however, that works not, but believes on him that justifies the ungodly man, his faith is counted for righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: Even as David also speaks of the blessedness of the man to whom God counts righteousness without works:

verses.text: Even as David also speaks of the blessedness of the man to whom God counts righteousness without works:

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are they whose transgressions are forgiven, and whose sins are covered:

verses.text: Blessed are they whose transgressions are forgiven, and whose sins are covered:

sinaiticus.text: blessed is the man whose sin the Lord will not count.

verses.text: blessed is the man whose sin the Lord will not count.

sinaiticus.text: Is this blessedness, then, upon the circumcision only, or also upon the uncircumcision? For we say: Faith was counted to Abraham for righteousness.

verses.text: Is this blessedness, then, upon the circumcision only, or also upon the uncircumcision? For we say: Faith was counted to Abraham for righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: How, then, was it counted? While he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

verses.text: How, then, was it counted? While he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

sinaiticus.text: And he received a sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while in uncircumcision, that he might be the father of all that believe while yet in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be counted to them,

verses.text: And he received a sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while in uncircumcision, that he might be the father of all that believe while yet in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be counted to them,

sinaiticus.text: and the father of circumcision to them that are not of the circumcision only, but that also walk in the steps of the faith of our father Abraham, which he had while in uncircumcision.

verses.text: and the father of circumcision to them that are not of the circumcision only, but that also walk in the steps of the faith of our father Abraham, which he had while in uncircumcision.

sinaiticus.text: For not through law was the promise to Abraham, or to his posterity, that he should be heir of the world, but through the righteousness of faith.

verses.text: For not through law was the promise to Abraham, or to his posterity, that he should be heir of the world, but through the righteousness of faith.

sinaiticus.text: For if they that are of law are heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is rendered powerless;

verses.text: For if they that are of law are heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is rendered powerless;

sinaiticus.text: for the law works wrath; for where no law is, neither is there transgression.

verses.text: for the law works wrath; for where no law is, neither is there transgression.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore it is of faith, that it might be according to grace, in order that the promise may be sure to all the posterity; not to that of the law only, but also to that of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all.

verses.text: Therefore it is of faith, that it might be according to grace, in order that the promise may be sure to all the posterity; not to that of the law only, but also to that of the faith of Abraham, who is the father of us all.

sinaiticus.text: As it is written: A father of many nations have I made thee before him whom he believed, even God, who makes the dead alive and calls things that are not as if they are:

verses.text: As it is written: A father of many nations have I made thee before him whom he believed, even God, who makes the dead alive and calls things that are not as if they are:

sinaiticus.text: who against hope on hope believed, in order that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which was spoken: So shall thy posterity be;

verses.text: who against hope on hope believed, in order that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which was spoken: So shall thy posterity be;

sinaiticus.text: and not being weak in faith, he considered his own body that had become dead, being about a hundred years old and the deadness of Sarah’s womb;

verses.text: and not being weak in faith, he considered his own body that had become dead, being about a hundred years old and the deadness of Sarah’s womb;

sinaiticus.text: but in regard to the promise of God he doubted not through unbelief, but grew strong in faith, giving glory to God,

verses.text: but in regard to the promise of God he doubted not through unbelief, but grew strong in faith, giving glory to God,

sinaiticus.text: and being fully persuaded that what he had promised he was able also to perform.

verses.text: and being fully persuaded that what he had promised he was able also to perform.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore also it was counted to him for righteousness.276

verses.text: Wherefore also it was counted to him for righteousness.276

sinaiticus.text: It was not written, however, for his sake, only that it was counted to him,

verses.text: It was not written, however, for his sake, only that it was counted to him,

sinaiticus.text: but also for the sake of us. to whom it shall be counted if we believe on him that raised Jesus our Lord from the dead,

verses.text: but also for the sake of us. to whom it shall be counted if we believe on him that raised Jesus our Lord from the dead,

sinaiticus.text: who was delivered up because of our offenses, and raised because of our justification.

verses.text: who was delivered up because of our offenses, and raised because of our justification.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,

verses.text: Therefore, being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,

sinaiticus.text: through whom, also, we have had the access, by faith, into this grace in which we stand, and we boast in hope of the glory of God.

verses.text: through whom, also, we have had the access, by faith, into this grace in which we stand, and we boast in hope of the glory of God.

sinaiticus.text: And not only so, but we also boast in afflictions, knowing that affliction works endurance,

verses.text: And not only so, but we also boast in afflictions, knowing that affliction works endurance,

sinaiticus.text: and endurance approval, and approval, hope;

verses.text: and endurance approval, and approval, hope;

sinaiticus.text: and hope makes not ashamed, because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts through the Holy Spirit that was given to us.

verses.text: and hope makes not ashamed, because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts through the Holy Spirit that was given to us.

sinaiticus.text: Furthermore, we being yet without strength, at the proper time Christ died for the ungodly.

verses.text: Furthermore, we being yet without strength, at the proper time Christ died for the ungodly.

sinaiticus.text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die; though for the good man perhaps some one would even dare to die;

verses.text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die; though for the good man perhaps some one would even dare to die;

sinaiticus.text: but God renders his love for us conspicuous in this, that, we being yet sinners, Christ died for us.

verses.text: but God renders his love for us conspicuous in this, that, we being yet sinners, Christ died for us.

sinaiticus.text: Much more, then, being now justified in his blood, we shall be saved through him from the wrath.

verses.text: Much more, then, being now justified in his blood, we shall be saved through him from the wrath.

sinaiticus.text: For if being enemies we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more having been reconciled we shall be saved in his life;

verses.text: For if being enemies we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more having been reconciled we shall be saved in his life;

sinaiticus.text: and not only so, but also glorying in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.

verses.text: and not only so, but also glorying in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, as through one man sin entered into the world, and through sin death, and so death passed through upon all men, inasmuch as all sinned;

verses.text: Therefore, as through one man sin entered into the world, and through sin death, and so death passed through upon all men, inasmuch as all sinned;

sinaiticus.text: for till the law sin was in the world, but sin is not imputed where there is no law;

verses.text: for till the law sin was in the world, but sin is not imputed where there is no law;

sinaiticus.text: yet, death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over those that did not sin after the likeness of the transgression of Adam, who is a type of the coming one.

verses.text: yet, death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over those that did not sin after the likeness of the transgression of Adam, who is a type of the coming one.

sinaiticus.text: Yet, not as the offense, so also the gracious gift; for if through the offense of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God and the gift in the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound to the

verses.text: Yet, not as the offense, so also the gracious gift; for if through the offense of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God and the gift in the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound to the

sinaiticus.text: And not as through one that sinned is the gift; for the judgment passed from one offense to condemnation, but the gracious gift from many offenses to the righteous decree.

verses.text: And not as through one that sinned is the gift; for the judgment passed from one offense to condemnation, but the gracious gift from many offenses to the righteous decree.

sinaiticus.text: For if, in the offense of one, death reigned through the one, much more shall they that receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, Jesus Christ.

verses.text: For if, in the offense of one, death reigned through the one, much more shall they that receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, Jesus Christ.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, as through one offense judgment came upon all men to condemnation, so also through one righteous deed, judgment came upon all men to justification of life.

verses.text: Therefore, as through one offense judgment came upon all men to condemnation, so also through one righteous deed, judgment came upon all men to justification of life.

sinaiticus.text: For as through the disobedience of the one man the many were constituted sinners, so also through the obedience of the one shall the many be constituted righteous.

verses.text: For as through the disobedience of the one man the many were constituted sinners, so also through the obedience of the one shall the many be constituted righteous.

sinaiticus.text: But law came in beside, that the offense might abound; but where sin abounded, grace exceedingly abounded,

verses.text: But law came in beside, that the offense might abound; but where sin abounded, grace exceedingly abounded,

sinaiticus.text: that, as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

verses.text: that, as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, shall we say? Let us continue in sin, that grace may abound?

verses.text: What, then, shall we say? Let us continue in sin, that grace may abound?

sinaiticus.text: Let it not be. How shall we that died to sin live any longer in it?

verses.text: Let it not be. How shall we that died to sin live any longer in it?

sinaiticus.text: Know you not that as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus, were baptized into his death?

verses.text: Know you not that as many of us as were baptized into Christ Jesus, were baptized into his death?

sinaiticus.text: We were, therefore, buried with him through baptism into death, that as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we, also, might walk in newness of life.

verses.text: We were, therefore, buried with him through baptism into death, that as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we, also, might walk in newness of life.

sinaiticus.text: For if we have grown together with the likeness of his death, we shall grow together also with the likeness of his resurrection,

verses.text: For if we have grown together with the likeness of his death, we shall grow together also with the likeness of his resurrection,

sinaiticus.text: knowing this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be made powerless, that we should no longer serve sin;

verses.text: knowing this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be made powerless, that we should no longer serve sin;

sinaiticus.text: for he that has died has been acquitted of sin.

verses.text: for he that has died has been acquitted of sin.

sinaiticus.text: But if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him,

verses.text: But if we died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him,

sinaiticus.text: knowing that Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more: death no longer has dominion over him.

verses.text: knowing that Christ, having been raised from the dead, dies no more: death no longer has dominion over him.

sinaiticus.text: For in that he died, to sin he died once for all; but in that he lives, he lives to God.

verses.text: For in that he died, to sin he died once for all; but in that he lives, he lives to God.

sinaiticus.text: Thus do you also count yourselves dead indeed to sin, but living to God in Christ Jesus.

verses.text: Thus do you also count yourselves dead indeed to sin, but living to God in Christ Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore let not sin reign in your mortal body, in order to obey its desires;278

verses.text: Therefore let not sin reign in your mortal body, in order to obey its desires;278

sinaiticus.text: neither present your members as instruments of unrighteousness to sin, but present yourselves to God as being alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.

verses.text: neither present your members as instruments of unrighteousness to sin, but present yourselves to God as being alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God.

sinaiticus.text: For sin shall not have dominion over you; for you are not under law, but under grace.

verses.text: For sin shall not have dominion over you; for you are not under law, but under grace.

sinaiticus.text: What then? shall we sin because we are not under law, but under grace? Let it not be.

verses.text: What then? shall we sin because we are not under law, but under grace? Let it not be.

sinaiticus.text: Know you not that to whom you present yourselves servants for obedience, his servants you are whom you obey, either of sin to death, or of obedience to righteousness?

verses.text: Know you not that to whom you present yourselves servants for obedience, his servants you are whom you obey, either of sin to death, or of obedience to righteousness?

sinaiticus.text: But thanks to God that you were servants of sin, but you obeyed from the heart the form of teaching into which you were delivered,

verses.text: But thanks to God that you were servants of sin, but you obeyed from the heart the form of teaching into which you were delivered,

sinaiticus.text: and having been made free from sin, you became servants to righteousness.

verses.text: and having been made free from sin, you became servants to righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: I speak as a man, because of the weakness of your flesh. For as you present your members servants to uncleanness and to lawlessness in order to lawlessness, so now present your members servants to righteousness in order to sanctification.

verses.text: I speak as a man, because of the weakness of your flesh. For as you present your members servants to uncleanness and to lawlessness in order to lawlessness, so now present your members servants to righteousness in order to sanctification.

sinaiticus.text: For when you were servants of sin you were free in respect to righteousness.

verses.text: For when you were servants of sin you were free in respect to righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: What fruit, therefore, had you then? Of which things you are now ashamed; for the end of those things is death.

verses.text: What fruit, therefore, had you then? Of which things you are now ashamed; for the end of those things is death.

sinaiticus.text: But now, having been made free from sin, and having become servants to God, you have your fruit to sanctification, and the end, life eternal.

verses.text: But now, having been made free from sin, and having become servants to God, you have your fruit to sanctification, and the end, life eternal.

sinaiticus.text: For the wages of sin is death; but the gracious gift of God is life eternal in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.text: For the wages of sin is death; but the gracious gift of God is life eternal in Christ Jesus our Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Know you not, brethren, for I speak to those that know law, that the law has dominion over the man as long as he lives?

verses.text: Know you not, brethren, for I speak to those that know law, that the law has dominion over the man as long as he lives?

sinaiticus.text: For the married woman is bound by the law to the living husband; but if the husband shall have died, she is loosed from the law of the husband.

verses.text: For the married woman is bound by the law to the living husband; but if the husband shall have died, she is loosed from the law of the husband.

sinaiticus.text: So then, if, while her husband lives, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress; but if her husband shall have died, she is free from his law, so that she is not an adulteress, though she be married to another man.

verses.text: So then, if, while her husband lives, she be married to another man, she shall be called an adulteress; but if her husband shall have died, she is free from his law, so that she is not an adulteress, though she be married to another man.

sinaiticus.text: So then, my brethren, you also became dead to the law through the body of Christ, in order that you should be married to another, him that was raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit to

verses.text: So then, my brethren, you also became dead to the law through the body of Christ, in order that you should be married to another, him that was raised from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit to

sinaiticus.text: For when we were in the flesh, the passions of sins which were through the law wrought in our members to bring forth fruit to death;

verses.text: For when we were in the flesh, the passions of sins which were through the law wrought in our members to bring forth fruit to death;

sinaiticus.text: but now we have been delivered from the law, having died to that in which we were held, so that we serve in newness of spirit and not in oldness of letter.

verses.text: but now we have been delivered from the law, having died to that in which we were held, so that we serve in newness of spirit and not in oldness of letter.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, shall we say? Is the law sin? Let it not be; but I had not known sin except through law; for I had not known desire unless the law had said: Thou shalt not desire.

verses.text: What, then, shall we say? Is the law sin? Let it not be; but I had not known sin except through law; for I had not known desire unless the law had said: Thou shalt not desire.

sinaiticus.text: But sin, taking occasion, through the commandment wrought in me all manner of desire; for without law sin is dead.

verses.text: But sin, taking occasion, through the commandment wrought in me all manner of desire; for without law sin is dead.

sinaiticus.text: Now, I was alive without law once; but when the commandment came, sin became alive,

verses.text: Now, I was alive without law once; but when the commandment came, sin became alive,

sinaiticus.text: and I died; and the commandment which was for life, this was found by me to be for death.

verses.text: and I died; and the commandment which was for life, this was found by me to be for death.

sinaiticus.text: For sin, taking occasion, through the commandment deceived me, and through it slew me.

verses.text: For sin, taking occasion, through the commandment deceived me, and through it slew me.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, the law is holy, and the commandment holy and just and good.

verses.text: So, then, the law is holy, and the commandment holy and just and good.

sinaiticus.text: Did, then, that which is good become death to me? Let it not be; but sin, that it might appear sin, working out death to me through that which is good, that sin through the commandment might become exceedingly sinful.

verses.text: Did, then, that which is good become death to me? Let it not be; but sin, that it might appear sin, working out death to me through that which is good, that sin through the commandment might become exceedingly sinful.

sinaiticus.text: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am flesh, sold under sin.

verses.text: For we know that the law is spiritual: but I am flesh, sold under sin.

sinaiticus.text: For what I work I know not; for I practice not what I wish, but what I hate this I do.

verses.text: For what I work I know not; for I practice not what I wish, but what I hate this I do.

sinaiticus.text: But if I do this that I wish not, I agree with the law that it is good;

verses.text: But if I do this that I wish not, I agree with the law that it is good;

sinaiticus.text: and now I no longer do it, but sin that dwells in me.

verses.text: and now I no longer do it, but sin that dwells in me.

sinaiticus.text: For I know that there dwells in me, that is, in my flesh, no good. For to will is present with me, but to work out the beautiful, not;

verses.text: For I know that there dwells in me, that is, in my flesh, no good. For to will is present with me, but to work out the beautiful, not;

sinaiticus.text: for the good that I wish I do not, but the evil that I hate, this I practice.

verses.text: for the good that I wish I do not, but the evil that I hate, this I practice.

sinaiticus.text: But if I do this that I wish not, I no longer do it, but sin that dwells in me.

verses.text: But if I do this that I wish not, I no longer do it, but sin that dwells in me.

sinaiticus.text: I find, then, the law, to me wishing to do the good, —That evil is present with me;

verses.text: I find, then, the law, to me wishing to do the good, —That evil is present with me;

sinaiticus.text: for I delight in the law of God according to the inward man,

verses.text: for I delight in the law of God according to the inward man,

sinaiticus.text: but I see a different law in my members warring against the law of my mind, and making me a captive in the law of sin that is in my members.

verses.text: but I see a different law in my members warring against the law of my mind, and making me a captive in the law of sin that is in my members.

sinaiticus.text: Wretched man that I am: who shall deliver me from the body of this death?280

verses.text: Wretched man that I am: who shall deliver me from the body of this death?280

sinaiticus.text: Thanks to God, through Jesus Christ our Lord: so, then, I myself with the mind indeed serve the law of God, but with the flesh the law of sin.

verses.text: Thanks to God, through Jesus Christ our Lord: so, then, I myself with the mind indeed serve the law of God, but with the flesh the law of sin.

sinaiticus.text: There is, therefore, now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus.

verses.text: There is, therefore, now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made thee free from the law of sin and of death.

verses.text: For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made thee free from the law of sin and of death.

sinaiticus.text: For what the law could not do, because it was weak through the flesh, God, sending his own Son in the likeness of the flesh of sin, and on account of sin, condemned sin in the flesh,

verses.text: For what the law could not do, because it was weak through the flesh, God, sending his own Son in the likeness of the flesh of sin, and on account of sin, condemned sin in the flesh,

sinaiticus.text: that the righteous demand of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

verses.text: that the righteous demand of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: For those that are according to the flesh mind the things of the flesh, but those that are according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit.

verses.text: For those that are according to the flesh mind the things of the flesh, but those that are according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace.

verses.text: For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace.

sinaiticus.text: Because the mind of the flesh is enmity towards God; for it is not subjected to the law of God, neither indeed can it be.

verses.text: Because the mind of the flesh is enmity towards God; for it is not subjected to the law of God, neither indeed can it be.

sinaiticus.text: And they that are in the flesh can not please God.

verses.text: And they that are in the flesh can not please God.

sinaiticus.text: You, however, are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwells in you. And if any one has not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

verses.text: You, however, are not in the flesh, but in the Spirit, if so be that the Spirit of God dwells in you. And if any one has not the Spirit of Christ, he is none of his.

sinaiticus.text: But if Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is life because of righteousness.

verses.text: But if Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is life because of righteousness.

sinaiticus.text: And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he who raised Christ Jesus from the dead will also make your mortal bodies alive through his Spirit that dwells in you.

verses.text: And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he who raised Christ Jesus from the dead will also make your mortal bodies alive through his Spirit that dwells in you.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, that we should live according to the flesh.

verses.text: Therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, that we should live according to the flesh.

sinaiticus.text: For if you live according to the flesh, you shall die; but if through the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you shall live.

verses.text: For if you live according to the flesh, you shall die; but if through the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you shall live.

sinaiticus.text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.

verses.text: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God.

sinaiticus.text: For you did not receive the spirit of bondage again to fear; but you received the Spirit of adoption, in which we cry: Abba, Father.

verses.text: For you did not receive the spirit of bondage again to fear; but you received the Spirit of adoption, in which we cry: Abba, Father.

sinaiticus.text: The Spirit itself bears testimony with our spirit that we are children of God.

verses.text: The Spirit itself bears testimony with our spirit that we are children of God.

sinaiticus.text: But if children, also heirs: heirs, indeed, of God, but joint-heirs with Christ, if so be that we suffer with him. that we may also be glorified with him.

verses.text: But if children, also heirs: heirs, indeed, of God, but joint-heirs with Christ, if so be that we suffer with him. that we may also be glorified with him.

sinaiticus.text: For I reckon that the sufferings of the present time are not worthy

verses.text: For I reckon that the sufferings of the present time are not worthy

sinaiticus.text: For the earnest expectation of the creation awaits the revelation of the sons of God.

verses.text: For the earnest expectation of the creation awaits the revelation of the sons of God.

sinaiticus.text: For the creation was subjected to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who subjected it,

verses.text: For the creation was subjected to vanity, not willingly, but by reason of him who subjected it,

sinaiticus.text: in hope that the creation itself shall be freed from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

verses.text: in hope that the creation itself shall be freed from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.

sinaiticus.text: For we know that the whole creation groans together and is in pain together till now;

verses.text: For we know that the whole creation groans together and is in pain together till now;

sinaiticus.text: and not only so, but ourselves also, having the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, awaiting the adoption, the redemption of our body.

verses.text: and not only so, but ourselves also, having the firstfruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, awaiting the adoption, the redemption of our body.

sinaiticus.text: For by hope were we saved; but hope seen is not hope; for what any one sees, why does he also hope for it?

verses.text: For by hope were we saved; but hope seen is not hope; for what any one sees, why does he also hope for it?

sinaiticus.text: But if we hope for that which we see not, we with patience wait for it.

verses.text: But if we hope for that which we see not, we with patience wait for it.

sinaiticus.text: And in like manner the Spirit also helps our weakness. For we know not what we shall pray for as we ought, but the Spirit itself intercedes with groanings unutterable:

verses.text: And in like manner the Spirit also helps our weakness. For we know not what we shall pray for as we ought, but the Spirit itself intercedes with groanings unutterable:

sinaiticus.text: he, however, who searches the hearts knows what is the mind of the Spirit, that he intercedes for the saints according to the will of God.

verses.text: he, however, who searches the hearts knows what is the mind of the Spirit, that he intercedes for the saints according to the will of God.

sinaiticus.text: But we know that to those who love God all things work together for good, to those who are called according to his purpose.

verses.text: But we know that to those who love God all things work together for good, to those who are called according to his purpose.

sinaiticus.text: For whom he foreknew, he also predestinated to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be firstborn among many brethren;

verses.text: For whom he foreknew, he also predestinated to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be firstborn among many brethren;

sinaiticus.text: and whom he predestinated, these he also called; and whom he called, these he also declared righteous; and whom he declared righteous, these he also made glorious.* * By conferring on them the doxa—glory of the New Covenant.

verses.text: and whom he predestinated, these he also called; and whom he called, these he also declared righteous; and whom he declared righteous, these he also made glorious.* * By conferring on them the doxa—glory of the New Covenant.

sinaiticus.text: What shall we then say to these things? If God is for us, who is against us?

verses.text: What shall we then say to these things? If God is for us, who is against us?

sinaiticus.text: He indeed that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how will he not also with him freely give us all things?

verses.text: He indeed that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how will he not also with him freely give us all things?

sinaiticus.text: Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect? It is God who justifies.

verses.text: Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect? It is God who justifies.

sinaiticus.text: Who is he that condemns? It is Christ Jesus who died; yes, more, who has risen, who is at the right hand of God; who also intercedes for us.

verses.text: Who is he that condemns? It is Christ Jesus who died; yes, more, who has risen, who is at the right hand of God; who also intercedes for us.

sinaiticus.text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall affliction, or distress, or persecution, or hunger, or nakedness, or danger, or the sword?282

verses.text: Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall affliction, or distress, or persecution, or hunger, or nakedness, or danger, or the sword?282

sinaiticus.text: as it is written: For thy sake we are killed all the day; we are counted as; sheep for slaughter.

verses.text: as it is written: For thy sake we are killed all the day; we are counted as; sheep for slaughter.

sinaiticus.text: But in all these things we do more than conquer through him that loved us.

verses.text: But in all these things we do more than conquer through him that loved us.

sinaiticus.text: For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, nor angels nor principalities, nor things present nor things to come, nor powers

verses.text: For I am persuaded that neither death nor life, nor angels nor principalities, nor things present nor things to come, nor powers

sinaiticus.text: nor height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.text: nor height nor depth, nor any other created thing, shall be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.

sinaiticus.text: I speak the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing me testimony in the Holy Spirit,

verses.text: I speak the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing me testimony in the Holy Spirit,

sinaiticus.text: that I have great grief and unceasing sorrow in my heart.

verses.text: that I have great grief and unceasing sorrow in my heart.

sinaiticus.text: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh,

verses.text: For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh,

sinaiticus.text: who are Israelites, to whom belong the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the religious service, and the promises;

verses.text: who are Israelites, to whom belong the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the religious service, and the promises;

sinaiticus.text: whose are the fathers, and from whom is Christ according to the flesh: who is over all, God blessed for ever, Amen.

verses.text: whose are the fathers, and from whom is Christ according to the flesh: who is over all, God blessed for ever, Amen.

sinaiticus.text: But I do not say such a thing as: The word of God has failed. For these are not all Israel, who are of Israel;

verses.text: But I do not say such a thing as: The word of God has failed. For these are not all Israel, who are of Israel;

sinaiticus.text: neither, because they are the posterity of Abraham, are all children; but; In Isaac shall thy posterity be called:

verses.text: neither, because they are the posterity of Abraham, are all children; but; In Isaac shall thy posterity be called:

sinaiticus.text: that is, the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as the posterity.

verses.text: that is, the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as the posterity.

sinaiticus.text: For the word of promise was this: According to this season will I come, and Sarah shall have a son.

verses.text: For the word of promise was this: According to this season will I come, and Sarah shall have a son.

sinaiticus.text: And not only this, but also Rebecca, having conceived by one, our father Isaac, —

verses.text: And not only this, but also Rebecca, having conceived by one, our father Isaac, —

verses.text: for the children not yet having been born, neither having done any good or ill, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calls, —

verses.text: it was said to her: The elder shall serve the younger,

sinaiticus.text: as it is written: Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.

verses.text: as it is written: Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, shall we say? Is there unrighteousness with God? Let it not be.

verses.text: What, then, shall we say? Is there unrighteousness with God? Let it not be.

sinaiticus.text: For he says to Moses: I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.

verses.text: For he says to Moses: I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, not of him that wills nor of him that runs, but of God

verses.text: So, then, not of him that wills nor of him that runs, but of God

sinaiticus.text: For the Scripture says to Pharaoh: For this same purpose did I raise thee up, that I might show in thee my power, and that my name might be published in all the earth.

verses.text: For the Scripture says to Pharaoh: For this same purpose did I raise thee up, that I might show in thee my power, and that my name might be published in all the earth.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, on whom he wills he has mercy, and whom he wills he hardens.

verses.text: Therefore, on whom he wills he has mercy, and whom he wills he hardens.

sinaiticus.text: Thou wilt say to me therefore: Why does he yet find fault? For who has resisted his will?

verses.text: Thou wilt say to me therefore: Why does he yet find fault? For who has resisted his will?

sinaiticus.text: Yes, rather, O man, who art thou that replies against God? Shall the thing moulded say to him that moulded it: Why didst thou make me thus?

verses.text: Yes, rather, O man, who art thou that replies against God? Shall the thing moulded say to him that moulded it: Why didst thou make me thus?

sinaiticus.text: Has not the potter right over the clay to make of the same lump one vessel for honor and another for dishonor?

verses.text: Has not the potter right over the clay to make of the same lump one vessel for honor and another for dishonor?

sinaiticus.text: But if God—willing to show his wrath, and to make known his power, endured in much longsuffering vessels of wrath fitted for destruction,

verses.text: But if God—willing to show his wrath, and to make known his power, endured in much longsuffering vessels of wrath fitted for destruction,

sinaiticus.text: also that he might make known the riches of his glory on vessels of mercy, which he before prepared for glory?

verses.text: also that he might make known the riches of his glory on vessels of mercy, which he before prepared for glory?

sinaiticus.text: whom he also called, us not only from among the Jews, but also from among the Gentiles,

verses.text: whom he also called, us not only from among the Jews, but also from among the Gentiles,
