verses.text: as he also says in Hosea: I will call that my people which was not my people, and her beloved, that was not beloved;

sinaiticus.text: and it shall come to pass in the place where it was said to them: You are not my people, there shall they be called sons of the living God.

verses.text: and it shall come to pass in the place where it was said to them: You are not my people, there shall they be called sons of the living God.

sinaiticus.text: But Isaiah cries concerning Israel: Though the number of the sons of Israel be as the sand of the sea, the remnant shall be saved.

verses.text: But Isaiah cries concerning Israel: Though the number of the sons of Israel be as the sand of the sea, the remnant shall be saved.

sinaiticus.text: For a fulfilling and cutting short of the word will the Lord make on the earth.

verses.text: For a fulfilling and cutting short of the word will the Lord make on the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And as Isaiah predicted: Unless the Lord of Sabaoth had left us posterity, we had become as Sodom and had been made like Gomorrah.

verses.text: And as Isaiah predicted: Unless the Lord of Sabaoth had left us posterity, we had become as Sodom and had been made like Gomorrah.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, shall we say? that the Gentiles, that were not following after righteousness, attained to righteousness, the righteousness that is of faith;

verses.text: What, then, shall we say? that the Gentiles, that were not following after righteousness, attained to righteousness, the righteousness that is of faith;

sinaiticus.text: but Israel, following after a law of righteousness, did not attain to a law.

verses.text: but Israel, following after a law of righteousness, did not attain to a law.

sinaiticus.text: Why? because they sought it not by faith, but as by works: for they stumbled at the stone of stumbling,

verses.text: Why? because they sought it not by faith, but as by works: for they stumbled at the stone of stumbling,

sinaiticus.text: as it is written: Behold, I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense; and he that believes on him shall not be ashamed.

verses.text: as it is written: Behold, I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense; and he that believes on him shall not be ashamed.

sinaiticus.text: Brethren, the good pleasure of my heart, and my prayer to God for them, is for their salvation;284

verses.text: Brethren, the good pleasure of my heart, and my prayer to God for them, is for their salvation;284

sinaiticus.text: For I bear them testimony that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.

verses.text: For I bear them testimony that they have a zeal for God, but not according to knowledge.

sinaiticus.text: For, being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they have not submitted themselves to the righteousness of God.

verses.text: For, being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, they have not submitted themselves to the righteousness of God.

sinaiticus.text: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believes.

verses.text: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believes.

sinaiticus.text: For Moses writes that the man that does the righteousness of the law shall live in it.

verses.text: For Moses writes that the man that does the righteousness of the law shall live in it.

sinaiticus.text: But the righteousness that is of faith speaks thus: Say not in thy heart: Who shall ascend into heaven? that is, to bring Christ down:

verses.text: But the righteousness that is of faith speaks thus: Say not in thy heart: Who shall ascend into heaven? that is, to bring Christ down:

sinaiticus.text: or, Who shall descend into the abyss? that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.

verses.text: or, Who shall descend into the abyss? that is, to bring Christ up from the dead.

sinaiticus.text: But what says it? The word is near thee, in thy mouth and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith which we preach.

verses.text: But what says it? The word is near thee, in thy mouth and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith which we preach.

sinaiticus.text: Because, if thou shalt confess with thy mouth that Jesus is Lord, and shalt believe in thy heart that God raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved;

verses.text: Because, if thou shalt confess with thy mouth that Jesus is Lord, and shalt believe in thy heart that God raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved;

sinaiticus.text: for with the heart faith is exercised in order to righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made in order to salvation.

verses.text: for with the heart faith is exercised in order to righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made in order to salvation.

sinaiticus.text: For the Scripture says: Whoever believes on him shall not be ashamed.

verses.text: For the Scripture says: Whoever believes on him shall not be ashamed.

sinaiticus.text: For there is no difference between Jew and Greek; for the same is Lord of all, rich toward all that call upon him.

verses.text: For there is no difference between Jew and Greek; for the same is Lord of all, rich toward all that call upon him.

sinaiticus.text: For every one that calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

verses.text: For every one that calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved.

sinaiticus.text: How, then, shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear without a preacher?

verses.text: How, then, shall they call on him in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in him of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear without a preacher?

sinaiticus.text: And how shall they preach unless they be sent? As it is written: How beautiful are the feet of them that bring glad tidings of good things.

verses.text: And how shall they preach unless they be sent? As it is written: How beautiful are the feet of them that bring glad tidings of good things.

sinaiticus.text: But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says: Lord, who has believed that which was heard by us?

verses.text: But they have not all obeyed the gospel. For Isaiah says: Lord, who has believed that which was heard by us?

sinaiticus.text: So, then, faith comes from what is heard, and that which is heard comes through the word of God.

verses.text: So, then, faith comes from what is heard, and that which is heard comes through the word of God.

sinaiticus.text: But I say, have they not heard? Yes, verily, Their sound went forth into all the earth, and their words to the end of the world.

verses.text: But I say, have they not heard? Yes, verily, Their sound went forth into all the earth, and their words to the end of the world.

sinaiticus.text: But I say, did not Israel know? First Moses says: I will provoke you to jealousy by that which is no nation, by a foolish nation I will excite you to anger.

verses.text: But I say, did not Israel know? First Moses says: I will provoke you to jealousy by that which is no nation, by a foolish nation I will excite you to anger.

sinaiticus.text: But Isaiah is very bold, and says: I was found by them that sought me not, I became manifest to them that asked not after me.

verses.text: But Isaiah is very bold, and says: I was found by them that sought me not, I became manifest to them that asked not after me.

sinaiticus.text: But of Israel he says: All day long I stretched forth my hands to a

verses.text: But of Israel he says: All day long I stretched forth my hands to a

sinaiticus.text: I say, then, Did God cast away his people? It can not be; for I am an Israelite, of the posterity of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.text: I say, then, Did God cast away his people? It can not be; for I am an Israelite, of the posterity of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

sinaiticus.text: God did not cast away his people whom he foreknew. Know you not what the Scripture says in speaking of Elijah, how he complains to God against Israel?

verses.text: God did not cast away his people whom he foreknew. Know you not what the Scripture says in speaking of Elijah, how he complains to God against Israel?

sinaiticus.text: Lord, thy prophets they have killed, thy altars they have dug down, and I am left the only one, and they seek my life.

verses.text: Lord, thy prophets they have killed, thy altars they have dug down, and I am left the only one, and they seek my life.

sinaiticus.text: But what says the answer of God to him? I have reserved for myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal.

verses.text: But what says the answer of God to him? I have reserved for myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, even in the present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace;

verses.text: So, then, even in the present time there is a remnant according to the election of grace;

sinaiticus.text: now if by grace, no longer of works, since grace no longer becomes grace.

verses.text: now if by grace, no longer of works, since grace no longer becomes grace.

sinaiticus.text: What then? That which Israel seeks for, this he did not obtain, but the election obtained it, and the rest were hardened,

verses.text: What then? That which Israel seeks for, this he did not obtain, but the election obtained it, and the rest were hardened,

sinaiticus.text: as it is written: God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear, till this day.

verses.text: as it is written: God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear, till this day.

sinaiticus.text: And David says: Let their table become a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompense to them:

verses.text: And David says: Let their table become a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompense to them:

sinaiticus.text: let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back always.

verses.text: let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back always.

sinaiticus.text: I say, then, did they stumble that they should fall? It can not be; but by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles, in order to excite them to emulation,

verses.text: I say, then, did they stumble that they should fall? It can not be; but by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles, in order to excite them to emulation,

sinaiticus.text: But if their fall is the riches of the world and their worse estate the riches of the Gentiles, how much more their fulness.

verses.text: But if their fall is the riches of the world and their worse estate the riches of the Gentiles, how much more their fulness.

sinaiticus.text: But I speak to you, the Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I glorify my office,

verses.text: But I speak to you, the Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I glorify my office,

sinaiticus.text: if in any way I may excite to emulation my own flesh and save some of them.

verses.text: if in any way I may excite to emulation my own flesh and save some of them.

sinaiticus.text: For, if the casting away of them is the reconciliation of the world, what shall their reception be but life from the dead?

verses.text: For, if the casting away of them is the reconciliation of the world, what shall their reception be but life from the dead?

sinaiticus.text: But if the firstfruit is holy, so also the lump; and if the root is holy, so also the branches.

verses.text: But if the firstfruit is holy, so also the lump; and if the root is holy, so also the branches.

sinaiticus.text: But if some of the branches were broken off, and thou, being a wild olive, wert grafted in among them, and made a joint-partaker of the root and the fatness of the olive,

verses.text: But if some of the branches were broken off, and thou, being a wild olive, wert grafted in among them, and made a joint-partaker of the root and the fatness of the olive,

sinaiticus.text: boast not against the branches; but if thou boastest, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

verses.text: boast not against the branches; but if thou boastest, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

sinaiticus.text: Thou wilt say then: The branches were broken off that I might be grafted in.286

verses.text: Thou wilt say then: The branches were broken off that I might be grafted in.286

sinaiticus.text: Well: because of unbelief they were broken off, but thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear;

verses.text: Well: because of unbelief they were broken off, but thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear;

sinaiticus.text: for if God spared not the natural branches, neither will he spare thee.

verses.text: for if God spared not the natural branches, neither will he spare thee.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, then, the goodness and severity of God: towards those that fell severity, but towards thee the goodness of God, if thou continue in his goodness, otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

verses.text: Behold, then, the goodness and severity of God: towards those that fell severity, but towards thee the goodness of God, if thou continue in his goodness, otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

sinaiticus.text: And these, moreover, if they continue not in unbelief, shall be grafted in; for God is able to graft them in again.

verses.text: And these, moreover, if they continue not in unbelief, shall be grafted in; for God is able to graft them in again.

sinaiticus.text: For if thou wert cut out of an olive tree that is wild by nature, and wert grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree, how much more shall these the natural be grafted into their own olive tree.

verses.text: For if thou wert cut out of an olive tree that is wild by nature, and wert grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree, how much more shall these the natural be grafted into their own olive tree.

sinaiticus.text: For I do not wish you, brethren, to be ignorant of this mystery, lest you should be wise in your own conceits, that hardness, in part, has come upon Israel till the fulness of the Gentiles shall have come in;

verses.text: For I do not wish you, brethren, to be ignorant of this mystery, lest you should be wise in your own conceits, that hardness, in part, has come upon Israel till the fulness of the Gentiles shall have come in;

sinaiticus.text: and so all Israel shall be saved, as it is written: There shall come out of Zion the deliverer, he shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob.

verses.text: and so all Israel shall be saved, as it is written: There shall come out of Zion the deliverer, he shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob.

sinaiticus.text: And this is the covenant which they shall have from me, when I take away their sins.

verses.text: And this is the covenant which they shall have from me, when I take away their sins.

sinaiticus.text: As to the gospel they are enemies for your sake, but as to the election they are beloved for the fathers’ sakes:

verses.text: As to the gospel they are enemies for your sake, but as to the election they are beloved for the fathers’ sakes:

sinaiticus.text: for the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable.

verses.text: for the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable.

sinaiticus.text: For as you in time past believed not God, but now have obtained mercy through the unbelief of these,

verses.text: For as you in time past believed not God, but now have obtained mercy through the unbelief of these,

sinaiticus.text: so also have these now believed not, that through your mercy they also may now obtain mercy;

verses.text: so also have these now believed not, that through your mercy they also may now obtain mercy;

sinaiticus.text: for God has shut up all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

verses.text: for God has shut up all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

sinaiticus.text: O the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God: how unsearchable are his judgments and his ways past finding out.

verses.text: O the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God: how unsearchable are his judgments and his ways past finding out.

sinaiticus.text: For who has known the mind of the Lord? or who has been his counsellor?

verses.text: For who has known the mind of the Lord? or who has been his counsellor?

sinaiticus.text: or who has first given to him, and a recompense shall be made him?

verses.text: or who has first given to him, and a recompense shall be made him?

sinaiticus.text: For of him, and through him, and for him, are all things: to him be glory through the ages. Amen.

verses.text: For of him, and through him, and for him, are all things: to him be glory through the ages. Amen.

sinaiticus.text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, through the mercies of God, to present your bodies a sacrifice: living, holy, acceptable to God, which

verses.text: I beseech you therefore, brethren, through the mercies of God, to present your bodies a sacrifice: living, holy, acceptable to God, which

sinaiticus.text: And be not conformed to this age, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what the will of God is, the good, and acceptable, and perfect.

verses.text: And be not conformed to this age, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what the will of God is, the good, and acceptable, and perfect.

sinaiticus.text: For I say, through the grace that was given to me, to every one that is among you, that he think not of himself more highly than he ought to think, but that he think soberly, as God distributed to each a measure of faith.

verses.text: For I say, through the grace that was given to me, to every one that is among you, that he think not of himself more highly than he ought to think, but that he think soberly, as God distributed to each a measure of faith.

sinaiticus.text: For as in one body we have many members, but all the members have not the same office,

verses.text: For as in one body we have many members, but all the members have not the same office,

sinaiticus.text: so we the many are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another,

verses.text: so we the many are one body in Christ, and every one members one of another,

sinaiticus.text: but having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us; whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;

verses.text: but having gifts differing according to the grace that was given to us; whether prophecy, let us prophesy according to the proportion of faith;

sinaiticus.text: or ministry, let us wait on our ministry; or he that teaches, on his teaching;

verses.text: or ministry, let us wait on our ministry; or he that teaches, on his teaching;

sinaiticus.text: or he that exhorts, on his exhortation: he that gives, let him do it with simplicity: he that rules, with diligence: he that shows mercy, with cheerfulness.

verses.text: or he that exhorts, on his exhortation: he that gives, let him do it with simplicity: he that rules, with diligence: he that shows mercy, with cheerfulness.

sinaiticus.text: Let love be unfeigned. Abhor that which is evil, cleave to that which is good:

verses.text: Let love be unfeigned. Abhor that which is evil, cleave to that which is good:

sinaiticus.text: in brotherly love, be affectionate one toward another: in honor, preferring one another:

verses.text: in brotherly love, be affectionate one toward another: in honor, preferring one another:

sinaiticus.text: in diligence, not slothful: in spirit, fervent; serving the Lord;

verses.text: in diligence, not slothful: in spirit, fervent; serving the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: in hope, rejoicing: in affliction, patient: in prayer, persevering;

verses.text: in hope, rejoicing: in affliction, patient: in prayer, persevering;

sinaiticus.text: communicating to the necessities of the saints; following hospitality:

verses.text: communicating to the necessities of the saints; following hospitality:

sinaiticus.text: bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not.

verses.text: bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not.

sinaiticus.text: Rejoice with them that rejoice, weep with them that weep.

verses.text: Rejoice with them that rejoice, weep with them that weep.

sinaiticus.text: Be of the same mind one toward another; mind not high things, but condescend to things that are lowly: be not wise in your own conceits.

verses.text: Be of the same mind one toward another; mind not high things, but condescend to things that are lowly: be not wise in your own conceits.

sinaiticus.text: Render to no one evil for evil; provide for things honorable in the sight of all men;

verses.text: Render to no one evil for evil; provide for things honorable in the sight of all men;

sinaiticus.text: if possible, as far as it is of you, be at peace with all men;

verses.text: if possible, as far as it is of you, be at peace with all men;

sinaiticus.text: avenge not yourselves, beloved, but give place to the wrath; for it is written: Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord.

verses.text: avenge not yourselves, beloved, but give place to the wrath; for it is written: Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: If, then, thy enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink; for in doing this thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.

verses.text: If, then, thy enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink; for in doing this thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.

sinaiticus.text: Be not overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

verses.text: Be not overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.

sinaiticus.text: Let every soul submit himself to the authorities that are over him. For there is no authority except of God, and those that are have been appointed by God.

verses.text: Let every soul submit himself to the authorities that are over him. For there is no authority except of God, and those that are have been appointed by God.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, he that sets himself against the authority resists the appointment of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves condemnation.

verses.text: So, then, he that sets himself against the authority resists the appointment of God: and they that resist shall receive to themselves condemnation.

sinaiticus.text: For rulers are not a terror to the good work, but to the evil. And dost thou desire not to be afraid of the authority? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise from the same;

verses.text: For rulers are not a terror to the good work, but to the evil. And dost thou desire not to be afraid of the authority? do that which is good, and thou shalt have praise from the same;

sinaiticus.text: for he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he wears not the sword in vain; for he is the minister of God, an avenger to execute wrath on him that practices that which is evil.

verses.text: for he is the minister of God to thee for good. But if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he wears not the sword in vain; for he is the minister of God, an avenger to execute wrath on him that practices that which is evil.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore it is needful that you submit yourselves, not only because of wrath, but also because of conscience.

verses.text: Wherefore it is needful that you submit yourselves, not only because of wrath, but also because of conscience.

sinaiticus.text: For, for this reason you pay tribute also; for they are the ministers of God attending continually to this very thing.

verses.text: For, for this reason you pay tribute also; for they are the ministers of God attending continually to this very thing.

sinaiticus.text: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due, custom to whom custom, fear to whom fear, honor to whom honor.

verses.text: Render to all their dues: tribute to whom tribute is due, custom to whom custom, fear to whom fear, honor to whom honor.

sinaiticus.text: Owe no one any thing, except to love one another; for he that loves another has fulfilled the law.

verses.text: Owe no one any thing, except to love one another; for he that loves another has fulfilled the law.

sinaiticus.text: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not desire, and, if there is any other commandment, it is briefly summed up in this saying, in this: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

verses.text: For this, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not desire, and, if there is any other commandment, it is briefly summed up in this saying, in this: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.

sinaiticus.text: Love works no evil to the neighbor: love, therefore, is the fulfillment of the law.

verses.text: Love works no evil to the neighbor: love, therefore, is the fulfillment of the law.

sinaiticus.text: And this, knowing the time, that it is the hour, at which we should have already awaked out of sleep; for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.

verses.text: And this, knowing the time, that it is the hour, at which we should have already awaked out of sleep; for now is our salvation nearer than when we believed.

sinaiticus.text: The night is far spent, the day is at hand. Let us therefore put off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.

verses.text: The night is far spent, the day is at hand. Let us therefore put off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.

sinaiticus.text: Let us walk becomingly as in the day, not in riotings and drunkenness, not in lewdness and wantonness, not in contention and envy;

verses.text: Let us walk becomingly as in the day, not in riotings and drunkenness, not in lewdness and wantonness, not in contention and envy;

sinaiticus.text: but put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the desires of the flesh.

verses.text: but put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the desires of the flesh.

sinaiticus.text: Now, him that is weak in the faith receive, not to judgments of thoughts.

verses.text: Now, him that is weak in the faith receive, not to judgments of thoughts.

sinaiticus.text: One believes that he may eat all things, another who is weak eats

verses.text: One believes that he may eat all things, another who is weak eats

sinaiticus.text: Let not him that eats despise him that eats not; and let not him that eats not judge him that eats; for God has received him.

verses.text: Let not him that eats despise him that eats not; and let not him that eats not judge him that eats; for God has received him.

sinaiticus.text: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? To his own master he stands or falls; but he shall stand, for the Lord is able to make him stand.

verses.text: Who art thou that judgest another man’s servant? To his own master he stands or falls; but he shall stand, for the Lord is able to make him stand.

sinaiticus.text: One esteems one day better than another; another esteems every day alike: let each one be fully persuaded in his own mind.

verses.text: One esteems one day better than another; another esteems every day alike: let each one be fully persuaded in his own mind.

sinaiticus.text: He that regards the day, to the Lord he regards it. And he that eats, to the Lord he eats, for he gives thanks to God; and he that eats not, to the Lord he eats not, and gives thanks to God.

verses.text: He that regards the day, to the Lord he regards it. And he that eats, to the Lord he eats, for he gives thanks to God; and he that eats not, to the Lord he eats not, and gives thanks to God.

sinaiticus.text: For no one of us lives to himself, and no one dies to himself;

verses.text: For no one of us lives to himself, and no one dies to himself;

sinaiticus.text: for if we live, to the Lord we live, and if we die, to the Lord we die. If, then, we live, and if we die, the Lord’s are we.

verses.text: for if we live, to the Lord we live, and if we die, to the Lord we die. If, then, we live, and if we die, the Lord’s are we.

sinaiticus.text: For, for this purpose Christ died and lived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and the living.

verses.text: For, for this purpose Christ died and lived, that he might be Lord both of the dead and the living.

sinaiticus.text: But why judgest thou thy brother? And why dost thou despise thy brother? For we must all stand before the judgment-seat of God.

verses.text: But why judgest thou thy brother? And why dost thou despise thy brother? For we must all stand before the judgment-seat of God.

sinaiticus.text: For it is written: As I live, says the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

verses.text: For it is written: As I live, says the Lord, every knee shall bow to me, and every tongue shall confess to God.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, each one of us shall give an account of himself to God.

verses.text: So, then, each one of us shall give an account of himself to God.

sinaiticus.text: No longer, therefore, let us judge one another; but judge this rather, to put no stumbling-block or occasion of falling in your brother’s way.

verses.text: No longer, therefore, let us judge one another; but judge this rather, to put no stumbling-block or occasion of falling in your brother’s way.

sinaiticus.text: I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean of itself, but to him that thinks that anything is unclean, to him it is unclean.

verses.text: I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus that nothing is unclean of itself, but to him that thinks that anything is unclean, to him it is unclean.

sinaiticus.text: For if on account of meat thy brother is grieved, thou no longer walkest according to love. Do not by thy meat destroy him for whom Christ died.

verses.text: For if on account of meat thy brother is grieved, thou no longer walkest according to love. Do not by thy meat destroy him for whom Christ died.

sinaiticus.text: Let not, then, your good be evil spoken of.

verses.text: Let not, then, your good be evil spoken of.

sinaiticus.text: For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit;

verses.text: For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit;

sinaiticus.text: for he that in this serves Christ is acceptable to God and approved by men.

verses.text: for he that in this serves Christ is acceptable to God and approved by men.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, let us pursue the things of peace, and things by which we may edify one another.

verses.text: So, then, let us pursue the things of peace, and things by which we may edify one another.

sinaiticus.text: Do not for the sake of meat overthrow the work of God. All things, indeed, are clean; but it is evil for the man that eats so as to give offense:

verses.text: Do not for the sake of meat overthrow the work of God. All things, indeed, are clean; but it is evil for the man that eats so as to give offense:

sinaiticus.text: it is good not to eat flesh, neither to drink wine, nor anything by which thy brother stumbles.

verses.text: it is good not to eat flesh, neither to drink wine, nor anything by which thy brother stumbles.

sinaiticus.text: The faith that thou hast, have thou to thyself in the sight of God. Blessed is he that judges not himself in that which he allows;290

verses.text: The faith that thou hast, have thou to thyself in the sight of God. Blessed is he that judges not himself in that which he allows;290

sinaiticus.text: he that doubts is condemned if he eat, because he eats not from faith; and everything that is not from faith is sin.

verses.text: he that doubts is condemned if he eat, because he eats not from faith; and everything that is not from faith is sin.

sinaiticus.text: Now we the strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

verses.text: Now we the strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

sinaiticus.text: Let each one of us please his neighbor, for his good with a view to edification;

verses.text: Let each one of us please his neighbor, for his good with a view to edification;

sinaiticus.text: for Christ pleased not himself, but, as it is written: The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.

verses.text: for Christ pleased not himself, but, as it is written: The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.

sinaiticus.text: For whatever things were formerly written, were written for our instruction, that we, through the patience and the comfort of the Scripture, might have hope.

verses.text: For whatever things were formerly written, were written for our instruction, that we, through the patience and the comfort of the Scripture, might have hope.

sinaiticus.text: Now may the God of patience and of comfort grant to you to be of the same mind one toward another according to Christ Jesus,

verses.text: Now may the God of patience and of comfort grant to you to be of the same mind one toward another according to Christ Jesus,

sinaiticus.text: that with one mind you may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: that with one mind you may with one mouth glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, receive one another, as Christ also received you, to the glory of God.

verses.text: Wherefore, receive one another, as Christ also received you, to the glory of God.

sinaiticus.text: For I say that Christ became a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, that he might confirm the promises made to the fathers,

verses.text: For I say that Christ became a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, that he might confirm the promises made to the fathers,

sinaiticus.text: and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy, as it is written: For this cause will I give thanks to thee among the Gentiles, and to thy name will I sing.

verses.text: and that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy, as it is written: For this cause will I give thanks to thee among the Gentiles, and to thy name will I sing.

sinaiticus.text: And again he says: Rejoice, you Gentiles, with his people.

verses.text: And again he says: Rejoice, you Gentiles, with his people.

sinaiticus.text: And again: Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles, and applaud him, all you peoples.

verses.text: And again: Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles, and applaud him, all you peoples.

sinaiticus.text: And again Isaiah says: There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that rises to rule the Gentiles; in him shall Gentiles hope.

verses.text: And again Isaiah says: There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that rises to rule the Gentiles; in him shall Gentiles hope.

sinaiticus.text: Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, in order that you may abound in hope in the power of the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, in order that you may abound in hope in the power of the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: Now, my brethren, I am persuaded, even I myself, concerning you, that you also yourselves are full of goodness, having been filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

verses.text: Now, my brethren, I am persuaded, even I myself, concerning you, that you also yourselves are full of goodness, having been filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.

sinaiticus.text: I have, however, written more boldly to you, brethren, in some measure, as putting you in mind because of the grace that is given to me by God,

verses.text: I have, however, written more boldly to you, brethren, in some measure, as putting you in mind because of the grace that is given to me by God,

sinaiticus.text: that I should be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, ministering as a priest in the gospel of God, that the offering of the Gentiles might become acceptable, being sanctified in the Holy

verses.text: that I should be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, ministering as a priest in the gospel of God, that the offering of the Gentiles might become acceptable, being sanctified in the Holy

sinaiticus.text: I have, therefore, my boasting in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God;

verses.text: I have, therefore, my boasting in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God;

sinaiticus.text: for I will not dare to speak of any of the things that Christ did not work through me for the obedience of the Gentiles, by word and deed,

verses.text: for I will not dare to speak of any of the things that Christ did not work through me for the obedience of the Gentiles, by word and deed,

sinaiticus.text: in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Spirit of God, so that from Jerusalem and round about as far as Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.

verses.text: in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the Spirit of God, so that from Jerusalem and round about as far as Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.

sinaiticus.text: But so making it a point of honor, I have preached the gospel not where Christ was named, that I might not build on another’s foundation,

verses.text: But so making it a point of honor, I have preached the gospel not where Christ was named, that I might not build on another’s foundation,

sinaiticus.text: but as it is written: They to whom no message came concerning him, shall see, and they who have not heard, shall understand.

verses.text: but as it is written: They to whom no message came concerning him, shall see, and they who have not heard, shall understand.

sinaiticus.text: For which cause also I have been hindered many times from coming to you;

verses.text: For which cause also I have been hindered many times from coming to you;

sinaiticus.text: but now, no longer having a place in these parts, and having for many years a strong desire to come to you,

verses.text: but now, no longer having a place in these parts, and having for many years a strong desire to come to you,

sinaiticus.text: whenever I take my journey into Spain; for I hope, in passing through, to see you, and by you to be sent forward thither, if first I may be in some measure filled with you.

verses.text: whenever I take my journey into Spain; for I hope, in passing through, to see you, and by you to be sent forward thither, if first I may be in some measure filled with you.

sinaiticus.text: But now I am going to Jerusalem, ministering to the saints.

verses.text: But now I am going to Jerusalem, ministering to the saints.

sinaiticus.text: For Macedonia and Achaia have been pleased to make a contribution for the poor of the saints that are in Jerusalem.

verses.text: For Macedonia and Achaia have been pleased to make a contribution for the poor of the saints that are in Jerusalem.

sinaiticus.text: For they have been pleased, and their debtors they are; for if the Gentiles have shared in their spiritual things, they ought also to minister to them in carnal things.

verses.text: For they have been pleased, and their debtors they are; for if the Gentiles have shared in their spiritual things, they ought also to minister to them in carnal things.

sinaiticus.text: Having, therefore, performed this, and having secured to them this fruit, I will return through you into Spain;

verses.text: Having, therefore, performed this, and having secured to them this fruit, I will return through you into Spain;

sinaiticus.text: but I know that in coming to you I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of Christ.

verses.text: but I know that in coming to you I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of Christ.

sinaiticus.text: But I beseech you, brethren, through our Lord Jesus Christ, and through the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in prayers to God for me,

verses.text: But I beseech you, brethren, through our Lord Jesus Christ, and through the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in prayers to God for me,

sinaiticus.text: that I may be delivered from the disobedient in Judea, and that my service which is for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints,

verses.text: that I may be delivered from the disobedient in Judea, and that my service which is for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints,

sinaiticus.text: that, coming to you, in joy through the will of God, I may with you be refreshed.

verses.text: that, coming to you, in joy through the will of God, I may with you be refreshed.

sinaiticus.text: The God of peace be with you all. Amen.

verses.text: The God of peace be with you all. Amen.

sinaiticus.text: I commend to you Phebe, our sister, who is a deaconess of the church that is in Cenchrea,292

verses.text: I commend to you Phebe, our sister, who is a deaconess of the church that is in Cenchrea,292

sinaiticus.text: that you receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of saints, and that you aid her in whatever matter she may have need of you; for she has been a helper of many, of myself also.

verses.text: that you receive her in the Lord in a manner worthy of saints, and that you aid her in whatever matter she may have need of you; for she has been a helper of many, of myself also.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, my fellow-laborers in Christ Jesus,

verses.text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, my fellow-laborers in Christ Jesus,

sinaiticus.text: who for my life laid down their own necks, to whom not I only give thanks, but all the churches of the Gentiles:

verses.text: who for my life laid down their own necks, to whom not I only give thanks, but all the churches of the Gentiles:

sinaiticus.text: salute also the church that is in their house. Salute Epenetus, my beloved, who is the firstfruits of Asia to Christ.

verses.text: salute also the church that is in their house. Salute Epenetus, my beloved, who is the firstfruits of Asia to Christ.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Mary, who labored much for us.

verses.text: Salute Mary, who labored much for us.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen and my fellow- prisoners, who are well known among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

verses.text: Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen and my fellow- prisoners, who are well known among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.

verses.text: Salute Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Urbanus, my fellow-laborer in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

verses.text: Salute Urbanus, my fellow-laborer in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Apelles, approved in Christ. Salute those who are of the household of Aristobulus.

verses.text: Salute Apelles, approved in Christ. Salute those who are of the household of Aristobulus.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Salute those who are of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.

verses.text: Salute Herodion my kinsman. Salute those who are of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Tryphsena and Tryphosa, who labored in the Lord. Salute Persis the beloved, who labored much in the Lord.

verses.text: Salute Tryphsena and Tryphosa, who labored in the Lord. Salute Persis the beloved, who labored much in the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Rufus, the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

verses.text: Salute Rufus, the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren that are with them.

verses.text: Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren that are with them.

sinaiticus.text: Salute Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints that are with them.

verses.text: Salute Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints that are with them.

sinaiticus.text: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ salute you.

verses.text: Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ salute you.

sinaiticus.text: Now I beseech you, brethren, to mark those that cause divisions and offenses contrary to the teaching that you learned, and turn away from them;

verses.text: Now I beseech you, brethren, to mark those that cause divisions and offenses contrary to the teaching that you learned, and turn away from them;

sinaiticus.text: for such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly, and through good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

verses.text: for such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly, and through good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

sinaiticus.text: For your obedience has come abroad to all; I therefore rejoice over you: I desire, however, that you be wise in regard to that which is good, but harmless in regard to that which is evil.

verses.text: For your obedience has come abroad to all; I therefore rejoice over you: I desire, however, that you be wise in regard to that which is good, but harmless in regard to that which is evil.

sinaiticus.text: And the God of peace will bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

verses.text: And the God of peace will bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

sinaiticus.text: Timothy my fellow-laborer salutes you: Lucius also, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsman.

verses.text: Timothy my fellow-laborer salutes you: Lucius also, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsman.

sinaiticus.text: Gaius my host, and the host of the whole church, salutes you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, salutes you; and Quartus, our brother.

verses.text: Gaius my host, and the host of the whole church, salutes you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, salutes you; and Quartus, our brother.

sinaiticus.text: Now to him who is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery that was kept in silence during eternal times,

verses.text: Now to him who is able to establish you according to my gospel and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery that was kept in silence during eternal times,

sinaiticus.text: but is now made manifest, and through the Scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the eternal God, made known for obedience of faith among all nations,

verses.text: but is now made manifest, and through the Scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the eternal God, made known for obedience of faith among all nations,

sinaiticus.text: to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ: to whom be glory through the ages. Amen.294

verses.text: to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ: to whom be glory through the ages. Amen.294
